location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘19. Shaikh Saad and Kut-Al-Amara. Situation Night 25th-26th February 1917’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:365 x 655 mm, on sheet 470 x 680 mm

mods.abstract: Imprint:Heliozincographed at the Survey of India Offices, Dehra Dun. Simla Drawing Office, No. 3948, March 1925. S.D.O. 3936.Distinctive Features:Map of Shaikh Saad and Kut-Al-Amara [Al-Kūt] compiled from ground and air reconnaissance, produced to illustrate the movements of the British and the Turkish military forces on the night 25th-26th February 1917. Shows location of troops, trenches and lines of advance with positions of various headquarters indicated by symbols and explained in a key at the upper right hand corner. A line of the Light Railway defences also marked.Map overprinted with numeric reference grid.
